function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is an online Samsung store displaying various Samsung Galaxy products for sale in the 'M Series' category.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r14:"},"explanation":"Testing the submission of the customer information and proceeding to the final checkout by clicking on the 'Submit' button."}

messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.

Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases. Here is the filtered HTML source code of the web application: 'omitted'.

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is an online Samsung store with various product categories and a shopping cart feature.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r0:-galaxy"},"explanation":"Testing the functionality of navigating to the 'Galaxy' product category by clicking on the 'Galaxy' link in the menu."}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is an online Samsung store displaying various Samsung Galaxy products for sale.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r0:-home"},"explanation":"Testing the functionality of navigating to the home page by clicking on the 'Home' link in the menu."}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is an online Samsung store displaying various Samsung Galaxy products for sale.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r0:-m_series"},"explanation":"Testing the functionality of navigating to the 'M Series' product category by clicking on the 'M Series' link in the menu."}

function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is an online Samsung store displaying various Samsung Galaxy products for sale in the 'M Series' category.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":"6:rv:"},"explanation":"Testing the 'Add to Cart' functionality for the 'Galaxy M30' product by clicking on the 'Add to Cart' button."}

Start by describing the website supplied by the user. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then, describe the interaction to emulate. Finally, explain why that action was chosen.

Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: :r14:, :r0:-home, :r0:-galaxy, :r0:-s10, :r0:-m_series, :r0:-a_series, :r1:, :r2:, :r15:, :r16:, :r17:. Only use the send_keys action with writable elements. The writable elements have the following ids: :r18:, :r19:, :r1a:, :r1b:, :r1c:, :r1d:, :r1e:, :r1f:.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

keys.description: the keys to be sent to the input element

anyOf.description: sends keystrokes to an html element

explanation.description: Explanation of what should be achieved with the next action
